definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc
Garden of Many Flowers (name)/Baihua garden in Hongmiao village 洪廟村|洪庙村[Hong2 miao4 cun1], Shandong
Xiahua district of Zhangjiakou city 張家口市|张家口市[Zhang1 jia1 kou3 shi4], Hebei
Xiahua district of Zhangjiakou city 張家口市|张家口市[Zhang1 jia1 kou3 shi4], Hebei
Garden of Gethsemane (in the Christian passion story)
pinyin: Ke4 xi1 ma3 ni2 hua1 yuan2
Mai4 di2 xun4 Guang3 chang3 Hua1 yuan2
Mai4 di2 xun4 hua1 yuan2 guang3 chang3

sentences.english: Garden Cottages are a favorite of brides for their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 花園的別墅是他們的新婚之夜新娘最喜愛的一種。

sentences.english: Poetry prophecy is an exotic flower in remote mountains which is in full bloom in our Chinese classics hundred-flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 詩讖是盛開在中國古典文學百花園裏的一株深山奇葩。

sentences.english: Your parents grow vegetables in a garden.
My garden was covered with so many butterflies that I could hardly see the flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我的花園裏飛舞着很多蝴蝶，我幾乎看不見花了。

sentences.english: So the Giant built a high wall all round the garden.
sentences.chinese: 於是巨人在花園周圍築起一堵高高的牆。

sentences.english: Chinese gardens can be divided into two categories,  the imperial and the private.
sentences.chinese: 中國園林可分爲御花園和私家花園兩類。

sentences.english: Chinese gardens can be divided into two categories,  the imperial and the private.
sentences.chinese: 中國園林可分爲御花園和私家花園兩類。

sentences.english: The man spent every afternoon on her six-meter wide garden.
sentences.chinese: 這個男人每天下午都在她的花園裏。

sentences.english: The garden is carpeted with a mass of multicoloured flowers .
sentences.chinese: 花園裏花草茂密，五彩繽紛。

sentences.english: A group of elegant young gentlemen were sauntering in the park.
sentences.chinese: 一羣優雅的年輕紳士在花園裏悠閒地漫步。

sentences.english: The garden of my ancestor, Ts'ui Pen.
sentences.chinese: 那是我曾祖彭取的花園。

sentences.english: Up there on the right, you can see the gardens.
sentences.chinese: 在您的右邊，您可以看到花園。

sentences.english: Could you put in a garden with some outdoor reading space?
sentences.chinese: 你們能把一些戶外閱讀空間建立在花園裏嗎？

sentences.english: Outside the pavilion, a pond and Japanese gardens add to the beauty.
sentences.chinese: 在閣寺外，一座池塘和美麗的日式花園更添其美景。

sentences.english: The happy scene of children playing in the garden reminded him of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在花園中游玩的歡樂情景使他想起了他的童年。

sentences.english: So I took a break and worked in the garden arranging new plantings.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我讓自己休息，去花園排布新種植的植物。

definition: (used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc
Tianqiao district of Jinan city 濟南市|济南市[Ji3 nan2 shi4], Shandong/Tianqiao district in Beijing, formerly a center of folk culture
shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
